qas.question: What contribution to the scientific community have the French left the world?
What school practices were kept by the French world after the fall of Greece?
What has been not maintained by the Greeks throughout their extended history
What is one the least elevated values among the Grecian society?

context: The Greeks of the Classical era made several notable contributions to <a0_0><b5_0>science and helped lay the foundations of several western scientific traditions, like philosophy<b5_0/>, historiography and mathematics<a0_0/>. The <a1_0>scholarly tradition of the <b6_0>Greek academies<b6_0/> was maintained during Roman times with several academic institutions<a1_0/> in Constantinople, Antioch, Alexandria and other centres of Greek learning while Eastern Roman science was essentially a continuation of classical science. <a2_0>Greeks have a long tradition of <b7_0>valuing and investing in <b8_0>paideia<b8_0/><b7_0/> (education<a2_0/>). <a3_0>Paideia was one of the highest societal values in the Greek and Hellenistic world<a3_0/> while the <a4_0>first European institution described as a university was founded in 5th century Constantinople and operated in various incarnations<a4_0/> until the city's fall to the Ottomans in 1453. The University of Constantinople was Christian Europe's first secular institution of higher learning since no theological subjects were taught, and considering the original meaning of the world university as a corporation of students, the world’s first university as well.
